sprint_goal: Establish the foundational multi-tenant architecture, core security posture, and CI/CD pipeline to enable parallel development.
epic_coverage: Core Platform & Tenant Management, Security, Infrastructure & Operations
key_deliverables: Tenant registration API, comprehensive Firestore security ruleset, secret management infrastructure, automated CI/CD pipeline.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate CI/CD pipeline deploying a 'hello world' function; Showcase automated security rule tests passing in the pipeline; Manually create a new tenant using the backend function.
success_criteria: CI/CD pipeline is fully operational for backend services; Firestore security rules are implemented and achieve >90% test coverage; Tenant registration endpoint is functional.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Flaw in security rules leads to data leakage. Complexity of setting up a secure and reliable CI/CD pipeline with GCP authentication.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory, comprehensive automated testing for security rules; Peer review of CI/CD configuration by DevOps specialist.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.

sprint_goal: Implement the complete user lifecycle and onboarding workflow, from invitation to deactivation, including all necessary security checks.
epic_coverage: Core Platform & Tenant Management, Backend Business Logic & Workflows
key_deliverables: User invitation endpoint; User registration completion endpoint; User deactivation and session revocation endpoint; Login blocking for inactive users; Circular dependency validation for user hierarchy.
demo_objectives: Admin invites a new user; Invited user completes registration and logs in; Admin deactivates a user; Deactivated user is blocked from logging in; Show system blocking the creation of a circular reporting loop.
success_criteria: End-to-end user invitation and registration flow is functional; Deactivation correctly revokes access; Hierarchy integrity is protected.
risk_factors: Complexity of secure token handling for invitations; Ensuring immediate session revocation upon deactivation; Performance of hierarchy traversal for loop detection.
mitigation_strategies: Use industry-standard libraries for token generation; Rigorous integration testing for session revocation; Write efficient, unit-tested traversal algorithms.
integration_windows: Integration with SendGrid email service on days 2-3.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.

sprint_goal: Automate core business workflows for attendance, approvals, and notifications, and begin building external integration capabilities.
epic_coverage: Backend Business Logic & Workflows, External Service Integrations
key_deliverables: Clock discrepancy detection function; Correction approval function; Push notification trigger for events; Auto-checkout scheduled function; Approval escalation scheduled function; Google OAuth 2.0 backend handler.
demo_objectives: Show a record being flagged for clock discrepancy; Demonstrate a correction approval creating an audit log entry; Create an event and show the notification function being triggered (via logs); Manually trigger auto-checkout and escalation functions and verify data changes.
success_criteria: All business logic functions are implemented, tested, and deployed; All scheduled jobs are configured and tested in staging; Google OAuth flow backend is ready for frontend integration.
risk_factors: Complexity of timezone handling in scheduled jobs; Performance of notification fan-out for large teams; Security of the OAuth token exchange process.
mitigation_strategies: Use a robust date/time library and write extensive timezone-specific tests; Optimize Firestore reads for notification logic; Follow OAuth 2.0 best practices and conduct a security review.
external_dependencies: Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), Google Identity Platform.
integration_windows: FCM and Google OAuth testing throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.

sprint_goal: Implement critical and high-risk data lifecycle operations (purge, anonymize), deliver the Google Sheets export feature, and finalize operational infrastructure.
epic_coverage: Core Platform & Tenant Management, External Service Integrations, Security, Infrastructure & Operations
key_deliverables: Tenant deletion initiation endpoint; Scheduled tenant data purge function; Scheduled user data anonymization function; Google Sheets data export function; All required Firestore indexes; Monitoring and backup configurations.
demo_objectives: Initiate a tenant deletion and show its 'pending_deletion' status; Manually trigger and verify the 'dry-run' of the purge and anonymization functions; Show attendance data being automatically exported to a Google Sheet; Demonstrate configured alerts and backups in GCP.
success_criteria: All data lifecycle functions are implemented with extensive testing and safety measures (dry-run mode); Google Sheets export is fully functional; All operational infrastructure is configured and verified.
risk_factors: RISK-002: Risk of irreversible data loss from purge/anonymization functions. RISK-004: External Google Sheets API dependency. High sprint utilization (94%) leaves little room for unexpected issues.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory 'dry-run' mode and manual sign-off for destructive operations; Comprehensive error handling for Google Sheets API; Prioritize critical path tasks and communicate risk of spill-over.
integration_windows: End-to-end testing of Google Sheets integration on days 3-5.
burndown_target: Close monitoring of burndown due to high utilization.
